https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CaasbfdJdJg Mathologer: Infinite fractions and the most irrational number 

1473/50 -> 29,2,5,1,3


PI:
[3; 7, 15, 1, 292, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 3, 1, 14, 2, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, ...]

convergents:
3, 22/7, 333/106, 355/113, 103993/33102, 104348/33215

https://mathworld.wolfram.com/PiContinuedFraction.html

https://oeis.org/A002485
https://oeis.org/A002486

figure out what the most accurate convergent is that we can represent with int
and int64 - maybe define them as constants, so we can also do approximate
calcualtions invloving pi, e, etc


relevant files from Hollos: cfcv.c, cfrac.c, cfrat.c
